content:
As Odyl, I remember that last night vividly. We had been dancing around each other for years, and finally, we were on a mission together in the Unnamed City. Something about being there, in that place, brought all of our feelings to the surface. We started talking, really talking, about everything. About our hopes and fears, about the things we loved and the things we struggled with. It was like we were seeing each other for the first time.

Later that night, we ended up in my apartment, and things escalated quickly. It was like all of the tension and longing we had been feeling just exploded between us. It was intense and passionate, but also tender and loving. We didn't talk much, we just let our bodies do the talking.

The next morning, we were both a little shell-shocked. We knew we had to part ways, at least for a little while, and it was hard to leave each other's embrace. We said our goodbyes at the spaceport, promising to stay in touch and to see each other again soon. But that last night together, it was something special. Something that we both knew we would never forget.
